alert.note: Alert for Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:16PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Montezuma County through 445 PM MDT... At 415 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles east of Aneth to 11 miles northeast of Shiprock. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Montezuma County, including the following locations... Mesa Verde Natl Park and Towaoc. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 6. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 8 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River
